definition: to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough

sentences.english: This Button Hook makes dressing with one hand easier and quicker.
sentences.chinese: 這使得巴頓胡克敷料用一隻手更加容易和快捷。

sentences.english: Drizzle with olive oil and champagne vinegar for a light and tasty dressing.
sentences.chinese: 少少淋上橄欖油和香檳醋和可口的敷料。

sentences.english: Local treatment of pressure ulcers also includes using various dressings.
sentences.chinese: 壓瘡的局部治療還包括使用各種敷料。

sentences.english: The site, located near the neck or collarbone, is kept covered with a dressing.
sentences.chinese: 這一位於頸部或者領口下面的區域，是用敷料覆蓋的。

sentences.english: Gloves should will be donned before applying dressings to patient.
sentences.chinese: 在給病人換敷料前須戴手套。

sentences.english: But it’s not just gadgets. This is a new wound dressing.
sentences.chinese: 但它不只是小擺設，而是一種新型創傷敷料。

sentences.english: Small, clear dressings are changed frequently to prevent infection.
sentences.chinese: 小的，乾淨的敷料需要經常更換以避免感染。

sentences.english: Fresh human body placenta amnion is a new type biological dressing.
sentences.chinese: 新鮮人體胎盤羊膜是一種新型的生物敷料。

sentences.english: Dispose forceps and soiled dressing in a plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 鉗子和舊敷料放在污敷料袋內。

sentences.english: Dispose forceps and soiled dressing in a plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 鉗子和舊敷料放在污敷料袋內。

sentences.english: This situation makes dressing the wound awkward for nursing staff.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況使得傷口敷料難於護理。

definition: to smear/to apply glue or ointment to a surface
to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
